teks_text: Reading/Fluency. Students read grade-level text with fluency and comprehension. Students are expected to adjust fluency when reading aloud grade-level text based on the reading purpose and the nature of the text.

aware_text: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Expository Text. Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about expository text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.

teks_text: evaluate a summary of the original text for accuracy of the main ideas, supporting details, and overall meaning;
aware_text: evaluate a summary of the original text for accuracy of the main ideas, supporting details, and overall meaning.

aware_text: use different organizational patterns as guides for summarizing and forming an overview of different kinds of expository text.

aware_text: follow multi-dimensional instructions from text to complete a task, solve a problem, or perform procedures.

aware_text: explain the function of the graphical components of a text.

aware_text: evaluate various ways media influences and informs audiences; and

aware_text: Writing/Writing Process. Students use elements of the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, and publishing) to compose text.

teks_text: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for conveying the intended meaning to an audience, determining appropriate topics through a range of strategies (e.g., discussion, background reading, personal interests, interviews), and developing a thesis or controlling idea;
aware_text: plan a first draft by selecting a genre appropriate for conveying the intended meaning to an audience, determining appropriate topics through a range of strategies (e.g., discussion, background reading, personal interests, interviews), and developing a thesis or controlling idea.

aware_text: develop drafts by choosing an appropriate organizational strategy (e.g., sequence of events, cause-effect, compare-contrast) and building on ideas to create a focused, organized, and coherent piece of writing.

teks_text: revise drafts to ensure precise word choice and vivid images; consistent point of view; use of simple, compound, and complex sentences; internal and external coherence; and the use of effective transitions after rethinking how well questions of purpose, audience, and genre have been addressed;
aware_text: revise drafts to ensure precise word choice and vivid images; consistent point of view; use of simple, compound, and complex sentences; internal and external coherence; and the use of effective transitions after rethinking how well questions of purpose, audience, and genre have been addressed.

teks_text: edit drafts for grammar, mechanics, and spelling; and

aware_text: write an imaginative story that

teks_text: is logically organized with appropriate facts and details and includes no extraneous information or inconsistencies;

aware_text: write a letter that reflects an opinion, registers a complaint, or requests information in a business or friendly context.

aware_text: write responses to literary or expository texts that demonstrate the writing skills for multi-paragraph essays and provide sustained evidence from the text using quotations when appropriate.

teks_text: produce a multimedia presentation involving text and graphics using available technology.
aware_text: produce a multimedia presentation involving text and graphics using available technology.

teks_text: establishes a clear thesis or position;
aware_text: establishes a clear thesis or position.

teks_text: considers and responds to the views of others and anticipates and answers reader concerns and counter-arguments; and
aware_text: considers and responds to the views of others and anticipates and answers reader concerns and counter-arguments.

teks_text: includes evidence that is logically organized to support the author's viewpoint and that differentiates between fact and opinion.
aware_text: includes evidence that is logically organized to support the author's viewpoint and that differentiates between fact and opinion.

aware_text: write complex sentences and differentiate between main versus subordinate clauses.

aware_text: determine the meaning of grade-level academic English words derived from Latin, Greek, or other linguistic roots and affixes.

aware_text: complete analogies that describe part to whole or whole to part.

aware_text: Research/Research Plan. Students ask open-ended research questions and develop a plan for answering them.

aware_text: brainstorm, consult with others, decide upon a topic, and formulate a major research question to address the major research topic.

aware_text: narrow or broaden the major research question, if necessary, based on further research and investigation.

teks_text: Listening and Speaking/Listening. Students will use comprehension skills to listen attentively to others in formal and informal settings. Students will continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to:
aware_text: Listening and Speaking/Listening. Students will use comprehension skills to listen attentively to others in formal and informal settings. Students will continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity.

teks_text: listen to and interpret a speaker's purpose by explaining the content, evaluating the delivery of the presentation, and asking questions or making comments about the evidence that supports a speaker's claims;
aware_text: listen to and interpret a speaker's purpose by explaining the content, evaluating the delivery of the presentation, and asking questions or making comments about the evidence that supports a speaker's claims.

aware_text: follow and give complex oral instructions to perform specific tasks, answer questions, or solve problems.

teks_text: Listening and Speaking/Speaking. Students speak clearly and to the point, using the conventions of language. Students will continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to present a critique of a literary work, film, or dramatic production, employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, enunciation, a variety of natural gestures, and conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively.
aware_text: present a critique of a literary work, film, or dramatic production, employing eye contact, speaking rate, volume, enunciation, a variety of natural gestures, and conventions of language to communicate ideas effectively.

teks_text: Listening and Speaking/Teamwork. Students work productively with others in teams. Students will continue to apply earlier standards with greater complexity. Students are expected to participate productively in discussions, plan agendas with clear goals and deadlines, set time limits for speakers, take notes, and vote on key issues.
aware_text: participate productively in discussions, plan agendas with clear goals and deadlines, set time limits for speakers, take notes, and vote on key issues.

Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of poetry and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of drama and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to explain a playwright's use of dialogue and stage directions.
aware_text: explain a playwright's use of dialogue and stage directions.

aware_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Fiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the structure and elements of fiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding.

teks_text: explain the influence of the setting on plot development;
aware_text: explain the influence of the setting on plot development.

teks_text: analyze the development of the plot through the internal and external responses of the characters, including their motivations and conflicts; and
aware_text: analyze the development of the plot through the internal and external responses of the characters, including their motivations and conflicts.

teks_text: analyze different forms of point of view, including first-person, third-person omniscient, and third-person limited.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Literary Nonfiction. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about the varied structural patterns and features of literary nonfiction and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to describe the structural and substantive differences between an autobiography or a diary and a fictional adaptation of it.
aware_text: describe the structural and substantive differences between an autobiography or a diary and a fictional adaptation of it.

teks_text: Reading/Comprehension of Literary Text/Sensory Language. Students understand, make inferences and draw conclusions about how an author's sensory language creates imagery in literary text and provide evidence from text to support their understanding. Students are expected to determine the figurative meaning of phrases and analyze how an author's use of language creates imagery, appeals to the senses, and suggests mood.
aware_text: determine the figurative meaning of phrases and analyze how an author's use of language creates imagery, appeals to the senses, and suggests mood.

reporting_category: Reading/Comprehension of Informational Text/Culture and History

Students analyze, make inferences and draw conclusions about the author's purpose in cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and provide evidence from the text to support their understanding. Students are expected to explain the difference between the theme of a literary work and the author's purpose in an expository text.
aware_text: explain the difference between the theme of a literary work and the author's purpose in an expository text.
